payable.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a bill, debt etc that is payable must be paid
payable.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The rent is payable in advance.
Tax is payable on the interest.
a fee of £49, payable by the tenant
State pensions become payable to women at age 60.
payable.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a bill, debt etc that is payable must be paid, often by a certain date
payable.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Shareholders will receive a final dividend of 0.75p, payable on July 1.
Sanders’ donation was $450,000, payable over three years.
payable.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The company’s liabilities include accounts payable totaling $29.1 million.
payable.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a figure included in a company’s accounts showing the amount that has been or will be paid in dividends for a particular period of time
payable.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Surprisingly, the profit and loss account reveals in the latest year that dividends payable were greater than profits for the year.
payable.translation[1].definitions[3].de: a note relating to money that a company owes
payable.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: Proceeds from the share offering will be used to repay a portion of the company’s current notes payable.
payable.translation[1].definitions[4].de: a cheque that is payable to someone has that person’s name written on it and must be paid only to them
payable.translation[1].definitions[4].ex: Send a postal order or cheque for £2.50 made payable to Dent & Reuss Ltd.
